p: Former outbreaks of coronaviruses include the SARS-CoV, which broke out in Guangdong, China in 2002 ( Zhong et al., 2003) and was thought to only infect animals. This was followed by the Middle East respiratory syndrome virus (MERS-CoV) that broke out in Saudi-Arabia in 2012 ( Wang et al., 2013) and was shown to infect humans. The recent strains of human coronaviruses (HCoV) have been identified as HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 after intensive screenings ( de Wilde et al., 2018), which cause acute lung injury and acute respiratory distress syndrome and lead to pulmonary failure and fatality in humans.
